alert.note: Alert for Jackson County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 28 at 4:14AM PST until February 28 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST THIS MORNING BELOW 2000 FEET... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning above 2000 feet, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 6 inches. For the Winter Weather Advisory below 2000 feet, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...For the Winter Storm Warning, parts of Jackson County, including Butte Falls, Prospect and portions of Highways 140, 62, 227 and 238. For the Winter Weather Advisory, this includes the valley floors below 2000 feet. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 PM PST Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult and hazardous walking conditions are expected due to icy, snow covered roads and sidewalks. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Travel is strongly discouraged because of dangerous conditions. * If you must travel, keep tire chains, a flashlight, blankets, food, water, medications, and a fully charged phone with you. * The safest place during a winter storm is indoors. * A Winter Storm Warning means that severe winter weather is occurring and poses a threat to life and property. Take protective action now.
